revised_title: Proton-Enhanced NMR Studies of Coal and Coal Extracts
tldr: This article discusses the application of proton-enhanced nuclear magnetic resonance (NMR) to analyze the composition and structure of coal and coal extracts. The technique allows for the identification of four functional types of carbons in coals and provides insights into coal processing. The authors describe the principles of the technique, experimental parameters, and present examples of its application to model compounds and coal samples.
